meanings.definition: Behavior or attitude characterized by self-righteousness or moral superiority.
meanings.sent1: Her priggishness made it hard for others to connect with her.
meanings.sent2: His priggishness often led to conflicts with his friends.
meanings.sent3: Despite her priggishness, she had a kind heart deep down.
meanings.sent4: The priggishness of the politician was evident in his every word.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's priggishness made the students feel uncomfortable in class.

meanings.definition: The quality of being excessively concerned with propriety or etiquette.
meanings.sent1: His priggishness about table manners annoyed his dinner guests.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her priggishness when it came to social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The priggishness of the butler was comical at times.
meanings.sent4: The priggishness of the royal family was a topic of gossip among the servants.
meanings.sent5: The priggishness of the etiquette coach was unmatched in the town.
